dialogueText: The Duma was sort of the Russian parliament of 1917COMMA but they were appointed by the Tsar rather than being elected by the people
Speaker: Narrator

dialogueText: When the Tsar was overthrown in the 1917 February Revolution the Duma came to power as the de-facto leaders of the new Russian Republic
Speaker: Narrator

dialogueText: The lawyer Alexander Kerensky would eventually come to power in the Duma for all of his social work & being seen as a moderate
Speaker: Narrator

dialogueText: The other leading political group in this timeframe was the Bolshevik & Menshevik communists (Bolsheviks being the minorityCOMMA Mensheviks being the majority)
Speaker: Narrator

dialogueText: While initially being together in the Russian Social Democratic Labour PartyCOMMA they split up into the 2 groups
Speaker: Narrator

dialogueText: The Mensheviks were more willing to work with the newly established DumaCOMMA but the Bolsheviks were more anti-establishment
Speaker: Narrator

dialogueText: The Bolsheviks were led by the revolutionary Vladimir LeninCOMMA a convincing speaker Lenin was able to gain support for promising peaceCOMMA landCOMMA and bread
Speaker: Narrator

dialogueText: His right hand man was Leon TrotskyCOMMA another communist visionary with slightly differing views who had previously been a prominent member of the Mensheviks
Speaker: Narrator

dialogueText: Joseph Stalin on the other handCOMMA had previously been a sort of grunt for the partyCOMMA involved in the more sketchy fund gathering partCOMMA he would come to rapidly rise through the ranks
Speaker: Narrator

dialogueText: Despite the newfound power he kept some of his more brutal tactics and his views and Trotsky's would clash leading to disagreements and disunity
Speaker: Narrator

dialogueText: That's the basic overview of thingsCOMMA I hope this helped you get a better understanding of the world created for this experience. Have fun!
Speaker: Narrator
